messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi. Something just exploded at the end of Fayette.
Okay. Is there any fire?
There's fire.
Okay. It was a big boom?
It shook the house, and I'm on Elliott.
Alright. Do you see fire from your window now?
I do. At the end of Elliott Road, so Elliott at the end of Fayette.
It's at the end of Fayette?
Yes, I can see it from Elliott.
Alright. More callers, stay on the line.
Okay.
All right, I'll get them out. Thank you.
Thank you. Bye-bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I think there was an airplane crash.
Okay, where do you think it was?
Near Hanscombe.
Near Hanscombe?
Yep.
Okay. What's your name, sir?
My name's Mike Stevens. It's the back highway to Hanscombe.
What's your phone number?
There's a giant column of smoke?
Yes.
We do have officers heading that way right now. Thank you for the call.
Okay, thank you.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, I live at 16 Fayette Road, and I was sleeping when I heard a huge boom.
Okay.
I looked out my window, and the house across the street behind it, which is a base, looks like an atomic bomb went off. There’s a mushroom cloud and fire everywhere.
We have had several calls on it. We do have units heading in that direction. We don't know exactly what it is just yet.
Do I need to evacuate? It's close to my house.
We have police and fire both en route. We're going to try and get in touch with the base right now.
Should we stay put or leave?
I can't make that call right now because I don't know what's going on. If you're unsure, you can call us back later.
Okay, thank you. Bye.
9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, I'm on Hartwell Ave and I see a huge fire. I don't know if anyone's called it in, but it's behind all the office buildings.
It's behind all the office buildings off of Hartwell Ave?
Yes.
Okay, thank you very much.
All right. Bye-bye.
